verifiability_rationale: The reviewer's claim that the high cosine similarity in Fig. 3e makes the direct illustration of the latter loss term of Eqn 13 less informative is verifiable. Cosine similarity measures the cosine of the angle between two vectors. A high cosine similarity (close to 1) indicates that the vectors are pointing in very similar directions. The reviewer logically argues that if the preactivation values (which can be considered vectors) are highly similar, their cosine similarity will be high, making the absolute value of the loss term less informative on its own. The reviewer provides a logical reasoning to support their claim.

By pointing out the high cosine similarity and suggesting an alternative visualization, the reviewer provides a valuable insight for the authors.
